main event: A single light object was observed by military personnel near Guadalupe Island on February 12, 1961.
interesting points: The object appeared as a small, round, white light about the size of a BB pellet at arm's length., The light ascended and descended at a 45-degree angle while moving left to right in front of the observer's aircraft., The duration of the observation was approximately 5 minutes., No radar contact was made with the object, indicating that it was not detected by military radar., The conclusion drawn was that the observed object was likely a satellite.
witness description: John F. DuPriest, Captain, and Ronald T. Marchman, Technician, were the military personnel who observed the object.
